Item 8.01 - Other Events.content: On August 8, 2022, Apple Inc. (“Apple”) consummated the issuance and sale of several series of notes pursuant to an underwriting agreement dated August 1, 2022, among Apple and Goldman Sachs & Co. LLC, BofA Securities, Inc. and J.P. Morgan Securities LLC. The Notes are being issued pursuant to an indenture, dated as of October 28, 2021, between Apple and The Bank of New York Mellon Trust Company, N.A., as trustee, and an officer’s certificate dated August 8, 2022. The Notes were issued pursuant to Apple’s Registration Statement on Form S-3 (Reg. No. 333-260578). Interest on the Notes will be paid semi-annually in arrears on August 8 and February 8 of each year, beginning on February 8, 2023. The Notes are Apple’s senior unsecured obligations and will rank equally with Apple’s other unsecured and unsubordinated debt. The description is qualified by reference to the Underwriting Agreement (Exhibit 1.1), the Indenture, and the Officer’s Certificate (Exhibits 4.1-4.5). An opinion on the legality of the Notes is filed as Exhibit 5.1.

subsections.Notes Issued:
A total of $5.5 billion in aggregate principal amount of notes were issued, consisting of:
- $1,000,000,000 aggregate principal amount of 3.250% Notes due 2029 (the “2029 Notes”), maturing on August 8, 2029.
- $1,500,000,000 aggregate principal amount of 3.350% Notes due 2032 (the “2032 Notes”), maturing on August 8, 2032.
- $1,750,000,000 aggregate principal amount of 3.950% Notes due 2052 (the “2052 Notes”), maturing on August 8, 2052.
- $1,250,000,000 aggregate principal amount of 4.100% Notes due 2062 (the “2062 Notes”), maturing on August 8, 2062.
